title: Solution Generating in Ten Dimensional Supersymmetric Classical Yang--Mills Theories
abstract: In a recent paper (hep-th/9811108), Saveliev and the author showed that there exits an on-shell light cone gauge where the non-linear part of the field equations reduces to a (super) version of Yang's equations which may be solved by methods inspired by the ones previously developed for self-dual Yang-Mills equations in four dimensions. Later on (hep-th/9903218), the analogy between these latter theories and the present ones was pushed further by writing down a set of super partial linear differential equations which are the analogues of the Lax pair of Belavin and Zakharov. Using this Lax representation, it is shown in the present article that solution-generating techniques are at work, which are similar to the ones developed for four dimensional self-dual Yang-Mills theories in the late seventies.
